channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Jersey City Faces a Stunning Budget Deficit, Report Shows
item.description: The city’s new mayor, James Solomon, is blaming his predecessor, Steven Fulop, who just became the head of an influential business advocacy group in N...

item.title: S&P rings up 5th loss in 6 days as tech stocks drag index down, led by AMD’s 17.3% drop
item.description: More than twice as many stocks rose within the S&P 500 than fell, but sinking technology stocks weighed on the index for a second straight day.

item.title: Short-seller claims IonQ, the biggest quantum computing company on the stock market, failed to disclose holes in its revenue
item.description: Short-seller Wolfpack Research says IonQ misled investors about cancelled government earmarks; it also points to suspicious insider stock sales.

item.title: Border Czar Says He Is Pulling 700 Immigration Agents Out of Minneapolis
item.description: About 2,000 personnel will be left in Minnesota, where President Trump’s immigration crackdown has generated outrage.

item.title: Mickey Lolich, Detroit’s Hero of the 1968 World Series, Dies at 85
item.description: Pitching for the Tigers, he notched three complete-game victories in defeating the St. Louis Cardinals for the championship, earning the Series’ M.V.P...

item.title: From ‘Operation Dirtbag’ to ‘Catch of the Day,’ Trump’s ICE nicknames ripped as ‘disgusting’ and ‘subhuman’
item.description: From operation "Swamp Sweep" to detention facilities like "Alligator Alcatraz," scholars say immigration operation names represent a "victory dance."

item.title: Why Bad Bunny is essential to the future of the NFL, even if Trump hates his halftime show
item.description: Unlike the NBA, the NFL doesn't have international markets already familiar with its game to expand into.

item.title: Nike, Accused of Bias Against White Workers, Is Under Federal Investigation
item.description: It appeared to be the first time the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission has targeted diversity policies at a large company.

item.title: Over a million people are losing power during a freezing snowstorm while data centers nearby guzzle electricity
item.description: The terms of data center agreements with local governments and utilities often aren’t available to the public.

item.title: Two Quit Human Rights Watch Over Shelved Report Criticizing Israel
item.description: Omar Shakir and Milena Ansari said they had quit over the stalled publication of a report that concludes it is a crime against humanity to deny Palest...

item.title: Babies, Robots and Climate Change
item.description: It’s often assumed that lower birthrates could help slow climate change and A.I. disruption. The reality is more complex.

item.title: Dutch Queen Joins the Military
item.description: Queen Máxima of the Netherlands enlisted as a reservist, the Royal House said, because the country’s security “can no longer be taken for granted.”

item.title: Former Prince Andrew Moves Out of Royal Home Amid Fresh Epstein Revelations
item.description: Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor was stripped of his titles last year and told to give up his grand residence because of growing concern over his links to J...

item.title: David A. Ross Resigns from Art School After Epstein Email Release
item.description: David A. Ross said he remained “ashamed” for having been “taken in” by Jeffrey Epstein. Mr. Ross resigned his position at the School of Visual Arts in...

item.title: Nigeria Attack Leaves More Than 160 Dead
item.description: The raiders stormed a rural community in central Nigeria, killing dozens and setting homes on fire in one of the country’s worst recent attacks.
